She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jemina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Jemina dreams of expanding her business and hopes to have a change in the status of their living. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is a 35-year-old. She lives in Silanga, Tangub City. She is married and has three children. Nina owns and manages copra [dried meat, or kernel, of the coconut], fish pond and farming businesses. She has been in business for 10 years already, generating an income of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

Nina has worked with GDMPC since 2011 up to now. She asked for a loan of 8,500 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
This is Jinky, 23, a resident of Silang, Cavite Philippines. She is married to Allan and is a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Jinky oversees and owns operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one unit of a tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business, the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 every day.

 To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and accessories and to pay for the maintenance of their motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Jinky hopes to have a good life and dreams of expanding her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Estella

texts.en: Estella is from Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old, married and has four children. Estella owns and operates a banana production business. She has been engaged in her business for 13 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Estella joined GDMPC. Estella is requesting a loan of 42,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
This is Rowena, 34, a resident of Tanza, Philippines. Her partner in life is Genelito, a worker abroad. She is a mother to her children. She, together with her children, manages their household as they operate the business. At this time, she and her partner are working hard to provide income to their family.

Rowena operates an internet café business. Services like this become a need as customers’ demand increases. Her main patrons are students, who require her services for school requirements. She has customers who need to rent computers for business purposes like writing a resume and office documentation, as well as customers who just love to surf the net and visit any social network. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in profit every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional computer parts and accessories needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rowena hopes to expand her business and have more computers. She dreams of giving all her children a good quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en: Mrs. Oyunchimeg is 56 years old and lives with her husband and two grandchildren in a ger in the Hovd province in Mongolia. Her husband, Pagma, runs a taxi service within the town. Her children married and moved out of their parents' house. Her grandchildren Enhtemujin, age 3, and Enhtemulen, age 1, stay home with her because their parents go to work and they have not reached kindergarten age yet. Mrs. Oyunchimeg has been running her tailoring business at home since 1991. She used to work at a state-owned tailoring company for years. She has built a strong relationship with suppliers and customers. She is now requesting 1,600,000 MNT to purchase inventory for her tailoring business from Ulaanbaatar at a cheaper price. She is a hardworking and kind person.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her tailoring business

loans.name: Maria Riselda

texts.en:
Maria Riselda works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines, and earns additional income from her variety store and from clothing sales. Maria Riselda is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more purified water to sell to her customers.

Maria Riselda has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more purified water to sell.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
Maria Teresa is 43 years old and has a common-law husband and seven children.

Maria Teresa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for 11 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Maria Teresa aspires to save enough money to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
This is Angela, 45, a  resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Vicente, a carpenter, and a mother to her children. Together with her husband, she manages their own household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

Angela operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugsof many sizes and shapes, from round palm-sized ones, to much larger doormats and other crafts that most rug-makers come up every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials for her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Angela hopes to expand her business and to have more customers. She dreams that all her children will finish their studies and that they will have a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
This is Marites, 45, a resident of Intramuros, Philippines. She is married to Cristoto, an employee, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marites operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Marites dreams of having a grocery store and hopes to have a good relationship with her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en:
Fausta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a decorations business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy starfish to sell to her customers.

NWTF is listing Fausta's business profile for a new loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy starfish to sell.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en: Rizalina is a 64-year-old resident of Cabungaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Rizalina has been helping her family with their needs from the little amount of 15,000 PHP that she has been gaining monthly from her coconut production business for the last 25 years. However, in 2007, she became a member of GDMPC and applied for a loan at GDMPC for 50,000 PHP to purchase farm fertilizer. Rizalina wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase farm fertilizer

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Juan de 20 años de edad, vive en el Municipio de Cañas Gordas, Antioquia, Colombia. Debido a la falta de educación las oportunidades de empleo son nulas, por lo cual se vio en la necesidad de obtener una fuente de empleo que le permitiera salir adelante y responder por su hija de 3 años. Fue así como decidió comprar una moto-carro y transportar personas dentro del casco urbano y a  las veredas aledañas. De esta manera se gana el pan diario y genera ingresos para ofrecerle a su hija condiciones de vida digna.
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito para realizar mantenimiento a la moto-taxi y mejoras  a la silletería, con el fin de mejorar la calidad en el servicio.
texts.en:
Juan is 20 years old and lives in the town of Cañas Gordas, Antioquia, Colombia.  Due to a lack of education, his opportunities for employment are zero, so he saw the need to obtain a source of income that would allow him to get ahead and support his three year old daughter, so he decided to buy a motorcycle car and transport people within the urban area and to surrounding areas.  He is able to earn his daily bread in this way and generate income to provide his daughter with a dignified home.

He is asking for this loan to do maintenance on his moto-taxi and make improvements to the seats so that he can provide better service.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his moto-taxi.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina, age 49, is a farmer. She is widowed and lives in Cabunga-an, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, with her three children. To make a living, Catalina plants and harvests banana and coconuts, which she then offers for sale. Catalina has been farming for 25 years and earns 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from these activities.

In 2007, Catalina joined GDMPC. Catalina is asking for a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to save money from her business as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa, age 50, is a widow with two children. She lives in Calabayan, Ozamis City. To make a living, Elsa operates a general store business. She has been in this business for five years and earns 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2007, Elsa joined GDMPC. Elsa is requesting loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to buy items such as milk, diapers, food products, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as milk, diapers, food products, etc.

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina is from Lapsan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is a 62-year-old widow with four children. She has owned and operated a general store at home for the past eight years. She earns about 6,000 PHP monthly from her business operations. 

Magdalina became a GDMPC member in 2006 and is now requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, Milo (malted milk), shampoo, soaps, etc. She hopes to sustain the store's revolving funds to prolong business operations.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Luz Ángela

texts.es:
La subsistencia en ocasiones suele convertirse en un gran reto para millares de familias que no cuentan con los recursos necesarios para salir adelante, éste es el caso de Luz Ángela, una mujer de 41 años y con tres hijos menores de edad.  Su precaria situación  económica la estaba consumiendo en la desesperación por la impotencia de no saber cómo generar los ingresos necesarios para sostener a sus hijos. Motivada por una amiga decidió vender fritos en la puerta de su casa con una pequeña freidora. Gracias a la buena atención y a su disciplina logró comprar un carro de comidas rápidas para mejorar su pequeño negocio. Hoy se siente muy agradecida por las bendiciones que ha recibido de Dios.
Su mayor sueño es que su negocio se siga consolidando para ofrecerle a sus hijos educación, por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de una carpa con el fin de mejorar la calidad en el servicio y generar mayores ingresos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Sustainment often becomes a great challenge for many families who don’t have the necessary resources to get ahead.  This is the case with Luz Ángela, a 41 year old woman with three minor children.  Her precarious financial situation was creating a sense of desperation because she didn’t know how to generate an income so she could support her children.  Motivated by a friend of her’s, she decided to sell fried foods from her home, using a small fryer.  Thanks to the good service and discipline, she was able to buy a fast food cart to improve her small business.  Now she if very grateful for the benefits that God has provided.

Her dream is to continue consolidating so that she can provide for an education for her children.  She is asking for this loan to buy a tent so that she can offer better service and generate a better income for her household.

loans.use: to buy a tent.

loans.name: Munkhtur

texts.en:
Mr. Munkhtur, 31 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Dornod, eastern province of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. 

Since 2010, Munkhtur has been running a superstore. Before operating the superstore, he had been transporting livestock, timber, and meats using his truck. Still today, during his free time, he transports the above mentioned items to customers. 

Within the vicinity of his superstore, there is no other similar type of business operating, so he has attracted quite a number of stable customers to his superstore. His wife works at a state specialized inspection agency, and his two elder children study at high school. 

Last summer, Munkhtur made an extension to the store and didn’t complete its door area, which is the primary source of losing its warmth. As they operate in their superstore day and night, they are in urgent need of insulating the superstore, as it can be considered their second home. So Munkhtur is requesting a loan of 4,800,000 MNT to purchase construction and insulation materials. 

As a result, the family can work in a very well-insulated and comfortable superstore, as well as burn less coal, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase construction and insulation materials to insulate his store.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta, 62 years old, is a married entrepreneur of Maningcol, Ozamis City. She has four children, and she earns income from her transport service business. She began the business almost eight years ago, and she earn 10,000 a month. To improve her business, Violeta is borrowing the amount of 48,500 PHP from GDMPC microcredit, to obtain motorcycle accessories and tires. She joined GDMPC in 2008. Violeta hopes to expand her business before long.

loans.use: to obtain motorcycle accessories and tires.

loans.name: Bilguun

texts.en:
Mr. Bilguun, 27 years old, lives with his family in Darkhan, the second-largest city of Mongolia. Since 2008, he has been working at a steel mill. He began as a coal heaver, and then advanced his career by becoming an assistant, an operator, and now a shift foreman. His wife is an elementary school teacher, but now stays at home with their infant child, who is one year old. Their first son, four years old, goes to kindergarten. Bilguun's mother is retired from work and lives with them. 

The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. As winter comes to Mongolia, the family is in urgent need of an insulated house -- if not, the mother and baby will be frozen to their core and may get sick. So Bilguun is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to purchase construction materials such as bricks, foam, fiberglass and cement. 

As a result of the construction, the family will be able to live in a comfortable and warm place. At the same time, the borrower will be able to work without worrying about the well-being of his wife and children. Most importantly, an insulated house can conserve energy and keep its warmth, and it will reduce the consumption of coal, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as bricks, foam, fiberglass and cement, to use for insulating his family's home.

loans.name: Nyamjargal

texts.en:
Mr. Nyamjargal, 34 years old, lives with his wife and son in Darkhan, the second-largest city of Mongolia. He has been working as a coal preparer in a steel mill for three years. Before working in Darkhan, he worked in a coal mine. His wife works as a seller in a local supermarket. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. Their son goes to kindergarten. 

As winter comes to Mongolia, the badly damaged house they live in becomes vulnerable to storms and frost. So they decided to insulate the house, as well as do some interior repairs. In order to make it happen, they are requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to purchase construction materials, such as bricks, foam, fiberglass and cement. 

Insulating their house will decrease the family's coal usage, contributing to environmental protection by reducing smoke emissions. Nyamjargal is a very hard-working individual, who strives for a better life, together with his family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to use for insulating his family's house and carrying out interior repairs.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana, 45, is a married mother of five kids living in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, where she runs a general store to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for 12 years and earns 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month from this work. 

Susana has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC to buy more items such as eggs, noodles, shampoo, soap and toothpaste. She became a member of GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Susana hopes to expand her retail business and to gain more profits.

loans.use: to buy more items such as eggs, noodles, shampoo, soap and toothpaste.

loans.name: Lusi

texts.en:
Lusi is 24 years old and married with two children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for two years. 

Lusi has requested a loan to buy ingredients needed. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Lusi will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil and baking soda for making pancakes.

loans.name: Leafa

texts.en: Leafa is a 19-year-old woman who is single with no children. She runs a business of printing materials in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. Leafa has requested a loan to buy materials and tools needed. She plans to use her profits to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new materials, paint and painting brushes.

loans.name: Tala

texts.en: Tala is 19 years old and single with no children. She runs a small business selling ice-cake in her community and has been doing this for two years. Tala has requested a loan to buy needed ingredients and materials. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tala will use her future loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, foam cups and sunfruit to make ice-cake.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a 59-year-old married woman and a mother of a grown-up daughter from Alicia, Bohol. She has run a sari-sari or variety store business for more than 10 years now. She sells various goods and commodities to the people in her locality. 

Alicia is asking for a loan to buy additional merchandise to sell like canned goods, candies, snack foods, cooking ingredients, soap and toiletries. With this stock, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and profit. In the future, Alicia has hopes of making her business a success and saving money for reinvestment in the same venture.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell like canned goods, candies, snack foods, cooking ingredients, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Flor De Peñas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE PEÑAS”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Veneranda es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejedoras de mantas, chofer, venta de queso, confección de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias con distintos rubros, donde la señora Veneranda es parte integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de promotora de la institución que fue a visitarla a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de queso, papa y chuño (papa ceca) da a conocer que este negocio lo heredó de sus papás ya que siempre trabajaron en estos negocios.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de vaca) que adquirirá de las comunidades aledañas, por mayor,  y posteriormente a la crianza lo comercializará a pedido en la Ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros.
texts.en:
The community association "Flor de Peñas" will begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the "Focal Center" of Achacachi. Its eight members are organized under a governing board, where Veneranda is the president. The businesses that the members of the community association manage are diverse, but include: blanket weavers, drivers, cheese mongers, and clothing makers. 

The loan received will benefit these small micro-entrepreneurs in distinct ways. Veneranda, who is an integral part, indicates that she joined Pro Mujer six months ago, upon the invitation of a promoter from the institution who visited Veneranda in her home. At present, Veneranda has a business selling cheeses, potatoes, and flour, a business she inherited from her parents who have always worked selling these items.  

The loan which they have applied for will be used to purchase a cow, which they will acquire wholesale from one of the surrounding communities. Later, once it has grown, it will be sold in the city of El Alto. This business allows Veneranda to generate income to be able to help with expenses around the house, as she is married and has two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Veneranda answers that she likes the savings.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Mamerta

texts.en:
Mamerta is 62 years old and a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ricardo, a driver, and is a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business.
At this time, she and her husband are working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
Mamerta owns and oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. She has one (14-16 person) jeepney. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 1000 every day.
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and for maintenance of her jeepney. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
Mamerta dreams of having more jeepneys and hopes to always be happy. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
-Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that make the Philippines truly the Philippines.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance for their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Pepe

texts.en: Pepe is a 26-year-old married woman with 2 children. She makes and sells pork buns, pancakes, etc. in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience in this business. Pepe needs a loan to help her improve her business. She plans to use her profits to provide financial support for her family. Pepe has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cooking oil, large cooking pot.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 49 years old and married with one kid.

Teresa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like bread, canned goods, soft drinks and slippers.

Teresa has borrowed and paid for 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 17 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Teresa aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like bread, canned goods, soft drinks and slippers.

loans.name: Fofoga

texts.en:
Fofoga is a 43-year-old married woman with two children. She makes and sells taro chips in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. Fofoga needs a loan to buy her new chip maker, ingredients, etc. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and support her family. 

Fofoga has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, taro, a cooking pot, new chip maker, and salts.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is married and a mother of three dependents. She is 64 years old and lives in Catadman, Osamiz City. Aida owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. She established the motorcycle transport business as a way of generating extra income of 3,600 per month. She has been engaged in this type of service for five years. Aida requested a loan of 5,000 from GDMPC. She intends to use the money from the loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories. 

Aida been a good member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Aida wants to purchase more motorcycles to use in her business.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Cristine Joy

texts.en:
Cristine Joy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 13000 PHP through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net for her business.

Cristine Joy has been in this business for two years. She also earns income from a general store.

Cristine Joy has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net

loans.name: Bernalda

texts.en: Bernalda is 56 years old and married. She is from Panta-on, Ozamis City. Her family has been in the business of raising bananas for 15 years. She has two adult children who help her take care of their bananas. They earn 4,000 PHP a month. In 2011, Bernalda joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and pay weeding costs. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and wants to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay weeding costs

loans.name: Debra

texts.en: Debra is a 34-year-old married woman with no children. She makes and sells BBQ in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience in this business. Debra needs a loan to buy meats and a new BBQ maker to enhance her business with higher quality. She plans to use her profits to support her family. Debra has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy chicken, sausages, mutton flaps, soy sauce, and onions.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is 43 years old and married with 6 children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy shampoo, canned goods, spices, and other items to sell in her general store.

Elenita has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Elenita aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, canned goods, spices, and other items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Sulita

texts.en: Sulita is a 20-year-old married woman with 1 child. She would like to start growing taro and bananas to earn a living. Sulita has requested a loan to buy bush knives, a wheelbarrow, chemicals, weed killer, fertilizer and other items for her farm. She has been a member of SPBD for 5 years. With her profits, Sulita will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, wheelbarrow, chemicals, weed killer, fertilizer and other items for her farm.

loans.name: Malaetele

texts.en: Malaetele is 26 years old and married with 5 children. She owns and operates a sewing business. She has 5 years of experience in this line of business. Malaetele needs a loan to purchase new sewing materials and a new sewing machine. She hopes to use her profits to help her providw good financial support to her family and kids. She joined SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, needles, and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 32 years old and married with 4 children. Two of her children are in school.

Maricel is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Maricel requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain this endeavor.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en: Akenese is a 44-year-old married woman with 9 children. She makes and sells baked goods like cakes, muffins, and pies in her community to earn a living. She has 4 years of experience with this business. Akenese needs a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, an oven and other cooking tools for her business. She plans to use her profits to improve her business. Akenese has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, and a new oven.

loans.name: Abanyeshaka Group

texts.fr:
Espérance fait partie du groupe  Abanyeshaka  et habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 50 ans et est mariée à Charles, un veilleur.  Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants, âgés de 16 à 28 ans, dont 3 étudient.
Elle a sous sa charge ses deux petits fils qui étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de  banane, de manioc frais et de pomme de terre depuis 28 ans. 

Elle est à son dixième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  de la pomme de terre et du haricot, à  revendre comme de nouveaux produits.
 
Le gain de son commerce, lui permet de satisfaire les besoins familiaux. Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait voir ses enfants continuer les études pour qu’ils l’aide à leur tour  dans les années à venir.
texts.en:
Espérance is a member of the Abanyeshaka group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 50 years old and married to Charles, a watchman. They have four children aged between 16 and 28, three of which are students. She has two dependent grandsons who are students.

She has been selling bananas, fresh manioc and potatoes for 28 years.

This is her 10th loan from Turame. With her Kiva credit, she will increase her capital and buy potatoes and beans for sale as new products.
The income from her commerce enables her to meet the family’s needs. Over the coming years she would like her children to continue their studies so that they in turn can help her in the future.

loans.use: she will increase her capital and buy potatoes and beans for resale as new products.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 64 years old and married with four children.

Francisca works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase rice, bread, soft-drinks and other groceries.

Francisca has borrowed and paid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 17 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Francisca aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice, bread, soft-drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 27 years old and married with 1 child. She has a pig farm that she cares for and sells in her village. She has been doing this for 3 years. Mary needs a loan to buy for new barbed wire to replace the old.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Mary will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire, coconut, and nails.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 52 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She buys and sells charcoal in the Philippines and requested a 27,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Elizabeth has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her charcoal business for 10 years and also earns income from farming rice.

Elizabeth aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is 47 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Celsa has a variety store business in the Philippines. Celsa requested a 17,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy canned goods, groceries, and other items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Celsa has been in this business for 12 years. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, groceries, and other items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Arcelie

texts.en: Arcelie is a 28-year-old married mother of two young children from Ubay, Bohol. She has had a fishing business with her husband for more than 10 years now. This is the source of their income. Arcelie is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, fish hooks, lead weights, and fuel for the boat. With these items, her husband will be able to enhance his daily catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. Arcelie hopes to expand their business and save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, fish hooks, lead weights, and fuel for the boat.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 40 years old and married with 7 children. With 4 children in school, Estelita works very hard to provide for them.

Estelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase stocks of canned goods, soap, noodles, and other items to sell in her general store.

Estelita has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future, Estelita would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of canned goods, soap, noodles, and other items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs

loans.name: Deroma

texts.en: Deroma is 36 years old and is married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur and has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines. Deroma requested a 15,000PHP loan through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell at her food stall. Deroma has been in this business for five years. In the future, Deroma would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Argel

texts.en:
Argel is a 25-year-old married man and the father of 2-year-old son.  He lives in Ubay, Bohol.  Argel is engaged in a food vending business where he makes and sells chorizo. He also has a hog-raising business.

Argel is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients for making chorizo, such as meat, sugar and seasoning. With this loan, he will be able to make more chorizo thus allowing him to sell more and earn more. Moreover, he wants to buy additional piglets to raise.

In the future, Argel hopes of making his business a success and of saving money for the future schooling of his son.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for making chorizo such as meat, sugar, and seasoning

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is 49 years old and married with 7 children.

Florenda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell such as soap, shampoo, noodles, sardines, etc.

Florenda has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from dress making.

Florenda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell, such as soap, shampoo, noodles, sardines, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is 48 years old and is married with six children. Florida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell, such as eggs, sugar, coffee, soap and canned goods.

Florida has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from raising pigs. Florida aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as eggs, sugar, coffee, soap and canned goods.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Ronelyn

texts.en:
Ronelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 12,000PHP through NWTF to purchase equipment for her fishing business.

Ronelyn has been in this business for two years and earns more income from a general store. Ronelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment for her business

loans.name: Flordelize

texts.en:
Flordelize is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

NWTF is listing Flordelize's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Evelyn Group

texts.en:
Evelyn is the leader of her group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

Evelyn is 43 years old and lives in Capucao, Ozamiz City. She is married with 5 children. 

Evelyn is vinegar retailer. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan in the amount of 5,500 PHP.

Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her living.

loans.use: to fertilize her corn.

location.town: Ozamis-P6 Capucao, Ozamiz City, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en: As a married parent of four children, Roselyn works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. Roselyn is borrowing 15,000PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell through her fish vending business. Roselyn has sustained her business activities through her previous 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 32 years old and lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children.

 Elsie has a sari-sari store and earns approximately 2,000PHP each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo and toothpaste.

 Elsie has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Elsie hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo and toothpaste.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is aged thirty and is a farmer in Nkubu county in Kenya where he lives with his wife and two children, both of whom are at school. He has been farming for the past ten years, producing maize, beans, milk, eggs and peas which he sells at the local market.

He is requesting 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase pesticides for his crops which will help him yield more produce and earn him extra income that will uplift his living standards. He will use some of the money to pay for his children's schooling. He aspires to buy another one acre piece of land in the next five years.

The high cost of fertilizer is his major challenge in farming.

loans.use: to buy pesticides

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of 7 children, Salvacion works hard to support her family.

She has a fertilized duck egg business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Salvacion is borrowing 20,000PHP through NWTF to purchase more eggs for her fertilized duck egg business.

Salvacion has sustained her business activities through 17 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more eggs for her business

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Consuelo is married with eight children. She is 54 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

 Consuelo sells noodles, canned goods and other items to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns 10,000PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 25,000PHP to purchase noodles, canned goods and other items.

 Consuelo has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Consuelo hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, canned goods and other items

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Emelda works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a welding shop. Emelda is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Emelda has sustained her business activities through her previous five loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her halo-halo.

loans.name: Paulina Group

texts.en:
This group consists of two partners residing at Teshie. They are Paulina and Comfort. They have been together for the past one year and are still doing very well. Comfort and Paulina sell vegetables and frozen foods respectively.

Comfort, the leader, is 47 years old married woman. She is married to Charles, a 48-years-old driver and they have a child who is in school. She has been doing this work for the past 12 years in the Teshie market.  She was given GHS 250 as her first loan which she had been able to repay accordingly. Comfort needs a loan amount of GHS 650 and Paulina 250 GHS to expand their businesses.

The two members together need GHS 900 to buy more goods and sell to their respective customers in the community.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia is married with four children. Felicia is 45 years old and lives in Timan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

 To earn a living, Felicia has a piggery. She has had this business for a year. Each month, she earns approximately 2,000 PHP. She has requested a loan to purchase more feed. 

Felicia has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Felicia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more feed

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is 35 years old. He is married and his wife is a businesswoman. He has been in business for four years. He wants the loan to buy more food stuff. The profit would be kept as savings.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Minata

texts.fr:
Née vers 1974, MINATA vit avec ses 5 enfants et son époux à MANA dans une  famille nucléaire dans la commune rurale de Ouelessebougou. 
MINATA s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa tante qui faisait le commerce d’articles divers. MINATA, après des années d’expériences  avec cette dernière, opta pour l’achat vente de céréales : niébé, mil, fonio, maïs, sorgho,etc.    
Après avoir correctement remboursé les trois prêts précédents, MINATA est à son quatrième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  3 tonnes de mil  auprès des paysans producteurs (à OUELESSEBOUGOU, MANA et MORIDJAMBOUGOU) et quelques rare fois avec les  grossistes de la place. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché de Ouelessebougou et dans les foires  environnantes à une clientèle composée essentiellement de consommateurs. 
MINATA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born around 1974, Minata lives with her 5 children and her husband in nuclear family in Mana, in the rural town of Ouelessebougou. 

Minata quickly became interested in income generating activities through her aunt who was selling various goods. After years of experience in that area, Minata decided to sell grains: cowpeas, millet, fonio (a millet-like grain), corn, sorghum, etc.    

After having properly repaid her three previous loans, Minata is on her fourth loan with Soro Yiriwaso, which she'll use to buy three tons of millet from village farmers (from Ouelessebougou, Mana, and Moridjambougou) and on rare occasions from local wholesalers. She sells her goods for cash, for credit, at home, in the Ouelessebougou market, and at local fairs - to a clientele consisting mainly of end consumers.

Minata would like to earn a monthly profit of 50000 FCFA, which she'll use to help her husband support the family, to repay the loan, and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy grains.

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en: Jean Damascene is 29 years old. He is married with one child who is one year old. His wife is a business woman. He has been in business for 6 years. He wants a loan to buy more pants and shirts. With the profit, he will make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more pants and shirts for sale.

loans.name: Madelene

texts.en:
Madalene is 45 years old. She is married with five children. The oldest child is 17 years old and the youngest is 5 years old. Her husband is a driver. 

She has been in business for five years, selling hardware. She wants the loan to buy more construction supplies for sale. The profit will feed her family.

loans.use: to buy more construction supplies for sale.

loans.name: Dante

texts.en: Dante is a 41-year-old man who lives in the village of San Antonio with his wife and three kids. He is a persistent and very responsible man with a great desire to get ahead every day. For eight years, Dante has run a grocery store in town. He sells mostly food products and manages to earn a significant income, which enables him to provide for his family. His business is the only income for the family. Dante requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to increase his revenues.

loans.use: to buy drinks, sugar, shampoo, and snack foods

loans.name: Ivan

texts.ru:
Иван - фермер. С 1997 года занимается выращиванием клубники  винограда и картофеля.
Справляться по хозяйству ему помогает супруга (на фото) и 21-летний  сын, он учится на строителя в техникуме.
Развитие деятельности начиналось с выращивания картофеля и винограда.
Иван решил приобрести оборудование для скважины и насос, т.к. в данной местности существуют  большие проблемы с водой для полива, особенно в летний период  засухи, полив виноградника и клубники приходится осуществлять вручную.
В планах на будущие:  расширить посадку новых сортов винограда, а также в планах поставить теплицу для выращивания клубники.
В личных планах: приобрести автомобиль, для транспортировки товара на рынки сбыта.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования оборудования для скважины.
texts.en:
Ivan is a farmer.  Since 1997, he has been growing strawberries, grapes, and potatoes.  He is helped on the farm by his wife (in the photo) and 21 year old son, who is learning the building trades in technical college.  Ivan started in business growing potatoes and grapes.  

Ivan and his son have decided to by equipment for a well and a pump since their region has a lot of problems with water for irrigation, especially during the summer dry period, when they have to water the grape vines by hand.

Among his plans for the future, Ivan wants to enlarge his plantings with new varieties of grapes and to build a greenhouse for growing strawberries.  Among his personal plans, Ivan wants to buy a vehicle for transporting his harvests to market.

He needs your help to finance the equipment for the well and pump.

loans.use: to purchase irrigation equipment

loans.name: Bujigmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Bujigmaa, 47 years old, lives with her family in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. Her son provides taxi services to local people by using his own car. One of her twin daughters has been working as a specialist at a supermarket since 2009, and other one runs her own business. Her daughter-in-law sells clothes at an outdoor market. She herself has been working as a doorkeeper at an electricity and heating station since 2004. Her two grandchildren go to kindergarten. 

This extended family resides in their house on a plot of land surrounded with fences. The fences are built with planks. As winter come to Mongolia, strong storms may break down the fences. Additionally, wooden planks are prone to fire, whether accidental or on purpose. They also deteriorate over the years. So they have decided to replace the planks with blocks in order to strengthen the fences. Advantages of block fences are an invulnerability to fire and the ability to keep the family warm by blocking the winds. People with wooden fences repair them by simply cutting forest trees. In order to protect the forest, block fences are encouraged everywhere. Mrs. Bujigmaa is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase blocks. As a result the family can live in a safe place without the fire hazard of wooden fences.

loans.use: to purchase blocks for building a fence

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 49 years old and married with 5 children.

Susan works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business with "nipa" woven palm matts used for house contruction and repair in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more inventory to sell.

Susan has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business for 6 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Susan aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of nipa woven palm matts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for his business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 41 years old, married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Vilma is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, soft drinks, etc. for her general store business.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Nexhat

texts.en:
Nexhat, thirty-one-years old, works in construction earning a very low salary. Nexhat is married and has one five-year-old son. They all live in a southern part of Kosovo. 

Nexhat has recently decided to start a small business, keeping cows to add to and increase his income. He plans to start selling milk and milk product to increase family income. Nexhat is now asking for a loan to purchase a cow. The loan will help him to provide his new business for selling milk and dairy products. In this way  he can improve living standard for his family. Nexhat hopes in the future to add additional cows and be able to sell the products for extra income. His goal is to give his child a better education. He thanks all Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: To purchase a cow for his new milk and milk products business

loans.name: Dukore Group

texts.fr:
J. d’Arc fait partie du groupe Dukore  un groupe  de femmes. J. d’Arc  habite à Bujumbura. Elle  a 40 ans et est mariée à Longin, un  chauffeur. Ensemble ils ont  6 enfants, âgés de 5 à 14, tous étudient.

Elle  fait le commerce de matériel de construction (tuyaux, fer à béton,…)  depuis 7 ans. 

Elle  est à son  septième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de matériaux de construction (ciment, fer à béton,…)  à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Avec les bénéfices de son commerce, elle parvient à satisfaire les besoins journaliers de la famille et assurer les frais de scolarité des enfants.  

Note: Le jour de l’octroi de crédit, Ildégonde était malade et  a donné une procuration à son mari Jonathan, qui apparaît dans la photo à sa place.
texts.en:
J. d'Arc is a member of the Dukore group, which is a group of women. J. d'Arc lives in Bujumbura. She is 40 years old and married to Longin, a driver. They have six children aged between five and fourteen, all of which attend school.

She has been selling building materials (pipes, reinforcing iron for concrete,) for seven years.

This is her seventh loan from Turame. With her Kiva credit she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of construction materials (cement, reinforcing iron,..) for resale in order to earn more.

With the profits from her commerce, she manages to meet the daily needs of her family and pay the costs of sending her children to school.

Note: The day that the loan was granted, Ildégonde was ill and gave power of attorney to her husband Jonathan, who appears in the photo in her place.

loans.use: she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of building materials (cement, reinforcing iron...) for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 25 years old and lives in Dullan, Aloran Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Leah sells dried fish to earn a living and has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan of Php 12,000 to purchase more inventory for her dried fish business.

In the future, Leah hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her dried fish business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 57 years old, single and a mother to three children. She operates a milk shop and also does dairy farming which has been her business for four years now and she gets a monthly income of 30,000 KES.

This is Jane's second loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase a dairy cow and she plans to use the profits to expand her business. 

In future she wants to become a successful business woman.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase irrigation equipment and water tanks.

loans.name: Fofo Group

texts.en:
This group consists of two members. Rebecca and Christiana sell fish and cosmetics at Teshie respectively.

Rebecca is a 42-year-old fish seller. The husband, Joseph, is 40 years old and a fisherman. They have two children. 

She has been selling fish for the past 23 years. She works from Mondays to Saturdays. This is her fourth loan, and she needs GHC 800 to buy more fish and sell to her customers. She has been able, out of this business, to educate her children to the high school level with the help of her husband. 

The group needs a total amount of GHC 1,500 to buy more goods to sell to their customers in the community.

loans.use: to buy fish and sell to customers.

loans.name: Merrylou

texts.en:
Merrylou is married and has three children. Merrylou is 40 years old and lives in Poblacion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay

Merrylou sells noodles, canned goods and other items to earn a living, and she had this business for 30 years. Each month, she earns 2,000 PHP doing this work. 

She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to purchase noodles, canned goods and other items.

Merrylou has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Merrylou hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, canned goods and other items.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 41 years old and married. She has three children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for six years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Josephine aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 42 years old and has a retail shop where she sells a variety of products. She has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns about PHP 5,000 doing this type of work.

She is married and has three school-age children. 

Catherine is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase canned goods, soft drinks, and other basic commodities to sell. In the future, Catherine hopes that her business will improve to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks and other commodities to sell.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra works hard to support her family. Myra is married and has a frozen foods business in the Philippines. Myra has been in this business for 25 years now.

Myra requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like hotdogs, chicken, etc.

In the future, Myra would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like hotdogs, chicken, etc.

loans.name: Teodula

texts.en:
Teodula is 45 years old, married and has 2 children, one of whom is in school. Teodula has a business selling sand and gravel in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years, and she is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy sand and gravel to sell. In the future, Teodula would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sand and gravel to sell.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is a dedicated mother who works hard to give her three children a better life. She makes a living by running a general store where she sells different commodities, including coffee, milk, candies, sugar, condiments and snacks. Her husband works as a farmer. 

Valentina has applied for a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers, and she hopes to expand her small shop into a grocery store in the future.

loans.use: to buy milk, coffee, sugar and spices to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Ian

texts.en: Ian is 26 years old and lives in Galingon, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. He is married with 1 child. He is a farmer and raises hogs to earn a living. He has been doing this for 1 year. He has requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase feeds for his hogs. He has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Ian hopes to expand his piggery.

loans.use: to purchase feeds of his hogs.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is taking out a new loan to invest in her tailoring business. With the previous loan, she was able to make improvements on her rental houses and therefore attracted even more tenants. The opening of this new line of operations was the result of her hard work and thanks to the support of the loan.

With this loan, Christine wants to add stock of fabrics, zippers, buttons and other sewing supplies so that she can fulfill some pending orders. She is a responsible woman who promises to repay her loan as scheduled, just as she did with her previous loan, since she believes in faithfulness.

loans.use: to add stock of fabrics, zippers, buttons and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 33 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Fe is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Fe has been raising pigs for eight years and also earns additional income from buying coconut shells.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is from the village of Cabisera 25. She is 64 years old. Carmelita is widowed and has four adult children. 

To earn a living, Carmelita raises livestock, primarily pigs, for fattening and resale. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for more than 40 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. Her previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Marcia De Jesús

texts.es:
En el Municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón una preciosa ciudad dedicada en diferentes actividades ubicada en el departamento de León, la Joven Marcia de Jesús es conocida como una persona responsable, honesta y dedicada a su trabajo.
Marcia se Llama la Joven de 33 años, nacida en este bello municipio, cuyo salario a duras penas cubre el sustento diario de su casa, se dedica a brindarle su servicio en la alcaldía, desempeñando el cargo como cajera, cuenta con tres hijos bajo su cargo, es madre soltera.
Ella estima que su familia va creciendo y desea construir un cuartito de madera y ladrillo para que sus hijos duerman un poco más cómodo.
 Dicho crédito lo estará invirtiendo en la compra de Sementó, Arena, Ladrillo.

  Estima que a fines de año su vivienda estará mejor, pero para entonces necesita que Ceprodel y Kiva le brinden este tipo de crédito, de momento solo cuenta con su buena salud, su capacidad de trabajo, y su honradez.
Agradezco a Dios como primer instancia por haberme encontrado con Ceprodel y Kiva, para que estos me sigan dando su mano amigable
texts.en:
In the Santa Rosa del Peñón municipality Marcia de Jesús is a young woman who is known to be responsible, honest, and devoted to her work.  She lives in a precious town in the León department where people devote themselves to different business activities.

Marcia, age 33, was born in this beautiful municipality.  Her hard-won salary covers the daily support of her household.  She is a municipal employee, and she works as a cashier.  She is a single mother with three children under her care.  She figures that her family is growing, and she wants to build a small room from wood and bricks so that her children are able to sleep a bit more comfortably.

She will use the loan to buy cement, sand, and bricks.  She calculates that by the end of the year her house will be better.  However, she needs this type of loan from Ceprodel and Kiva.  At this time she has good health, the capacity to work, and integrity.

She thanks God for having led her to Ceprodel and Kiva so that they will continue giving her a friendly hand.

loans.use: to buy cement and bricks.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is married and has three children. Emma is 24 years old and lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

To earn a living, Emma has a piggery. She has had this business for 14 years. Each month, she earns approximately 5,000 PHP. 

She has requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase feeds. 

Emma has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Emma hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed.

loans.name: Ma. Cecilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ma. Cecilia works hard to support her family.

She has a fertilized egg selling business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store, a burger stand, motorcycle transport and food vending. Ma. Cecilia is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to  purchase additional eggs for her fertilized egg selling business.

Ma. Cecilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional eggs for her business.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida, who is 49 years old, is from the province of Isabela. Imagine Isabela as a place of several hills, streams and lakes which are still present as the remains of a broken ecology. Aida is married and owns a sari-sari store (community-based store) as it is commonly called in their bario (village).  

Aida started working with one of her sister's stores. She closed her business and so Aida decided to set herself to pursuing the business. She happily enjoyed operating the business and now is making gradual progress. She works alone in her store from 8 in the morning until 10 in the evening, retailing food products. She is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy products like spices and soft drinks to sell in her store. With the help of this loan, she will do her best to improve her income. In the future, she would like to finish building her stall for more convenience to her customers.

loans.use: to buy products like spices and soft drinks to sell in her store.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is still married to Monica and their five children are going on well. His motorcycle business is doing well and he says that he is happy with the progress so far.

He is now applying for his second loan from KADET LTD which he plans to use to buy another motorcycle to enable him to expand his business. He is optimistic that the business will do better after the loan.

He hopes to buy a piece of land in the near future and build rental houses.

loans.use: to repair and service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
This is Analie, age 44, who is a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, in the Philippines. She is married to Roger, who is her business partner, and she is a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

Analie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns money by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community members. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, Analie is requesting a PHP 35,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Analie hopes that her business will continue to grow and that her family will be happier. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is an honest, responsible, and hardworking person who is 39 years old. She lives with her six children in Kisauni, Kenya.

Susan has a dressmaking business, and she needs a loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, pins, and needles. With this loan, she hopes that her sales will increase because fresh capital will enable her to offer more merchandise to her customers.

Susan hopes to be able to pay for her necessities and that her living conditions will improve a bit with this investment.

Sussan expects that in a year her business will be bigger and will be known throughout the area. Her dream is to continue working and, in this way, support her children in finishing their education so that they will become people of means.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, pins, and needles.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is married with 4 children. She is 54 years old and lives in Palomoc, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. She sells sawali (woven split bamboo mats used for covering walls) to earn a living and has had this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns about 10,000 PHP doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase materials for making sawali. Cecilia has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making sawali.

loans.name: Charlene

texts.en: Charlene works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years now. Charlene requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is a 52-year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has been engaged in food vending for some time now. This is the source of her income. Delia is asking for a loan to buy additional vegetables and other cooking supplies and seasonings like cooking oil, salt, pepper, sauce, vinegar and others. With this, she will be able to cater to more buyers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and income. Delia dreams of making her business a success someday and saves money for the reinvestment into the same ventures.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables and other cooking materials and seasonings, like cooking oil, salt, pepper, sauce, vinegar, etc.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn produces snacks that she sells in her village. She needs additional capital for the growth of her business, and so she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000. With the loan she will instantly purchase stocks of ingredients she needs for cooking. She believes that by having sufficient capital to run her business it will become more productive, which will bring her more income. This will benefit her children, most of whom are still studying. 

Jovelyn, a 39-year-old businesswoman, is from the village of Cabisera 25 province of Isabela. She is married to Noli who operates a passenger jeepney (a small bus) which they own. They have five children and Jovelyn wishes to provide a good future to all of them. No matter how hard it is to have a big family, she knows that they will be able to attain their dreams as long as there is strong determination among them.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, bananas, sugar and juices for her business.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 50 years old and married with seven children.

Lilia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, soap, eggs, etc..

Lilia has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for five years, and also earns an income from buying and selling footware.

Lilia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as canned goods, shampoo, soap, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Otgonkhuu

texts.en:
Mr. Otgonkhuu, 23 years old, lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. His mother is retired from work and now he renders taxi service to local people. On the same plot of land, his sister lives with her family. His sister buys coal at wholesale prices and sells it to customers at retail prices. During the holidays she bakes cake and cookies and sells them to local people. 

Soon in Mongolia, a national holiday known as 'white moon' will be celebrated and it is the best period for increasing her income. So our borrower Otgonkhuu is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to help his sister to get necessary raw materials used for preparing cookies and cakes. As a result, the family can generate more income for their young ones’ education and also can contribute to local economic development.

loans.use: To purchase necessary materials used for cookies and cakes

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru:
Зухро полна энергия  и новых идей. Она всегда старается новшеству. Она замужем, но еще не имеет детей.  Ее муж очень добрый человек, но не везучий. Все, что он начинает, все идет напролом.
