Grace is applying for her fourth loan now, and she needs GHS 1,000. She will use this amount to buy more fish to sell to her customers in the community.

loans.use: To buy more fish, to sell to her customers.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 23-year-old married man living in Kagadi Uganda. He has been operating a retail business for two years. He also works at a factory to supplement the business income. With the proceeds, he has been able to pay school fees for his children and buy land for farming. He would like to complete his house. Inadequate capital is affecting his business while his dreams are to own a wholesale shop and expand to other towns. John is requesting for a loan to buy cosmetics, water and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, water and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
This is Everlyne, 31, a resident of Voi, Kenya. She is married to Darmian, an employee, and is a mother of three children. Together with her husband, Everlyne manages their household while operating a business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

She operates a variety store. She has been in this business for the last three years. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. 
To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 50,000 KES loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Everlyne hopes to have a car and dreams of expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a 32-year-old government employee who works as a secondary school teacher . He has been in service for six years now. He is married, has three children and lives in Kagadi Uganda. His desire to contribute to the knowledge-building of the nation led him to the teaching profession. He also is involved in agriculture and cattle keeping for milk production to supplement his salary. His dreams are to educate his children and build a permanent residential house. Emmanuel intends to use the loan to buy iron sheets, nails for construction and pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets, nails for construction and pay for labor.

loans.name: Lizeth

texts.es:
Lizeth e suna joven de 19 años de edad, vive en la el Caserio de San martin de Porras, caracterizado porque habitan personas que hace algunos años pproductos de las inundaciones en la ciudad de Ica se quedaron sin vivienda y formaron esta localidad. Lizeth vive al lado de sus padres a quienes quiere mucho y sobre todo apoya con el fruto de su trabajo y quienes a pesar de su condicion humilde pudieron apoyarla y logro estudiar la carrera de Educacion.

Debido a que no pudo encontrar un empleo de acuerdo a su carrera Lizeth con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro logro formar su negocio de venta de productos cosmeticos, ella le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 10 horas al dia y puede atender hasta 10 clientes diariamente ya que ella va a visitarlos en sus domicilios; ella cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es muy amable con los clientes y tambien porque da facilidades para el pago de los productos.

Lizeth esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podra comprar un modulo de drywall para poder construir su cuarto ya que debido a las lluvias, el techo se cayo porque este era de esteras y adobe, con esta mejora ella podra tener uan mejor calidad de vida y seguir esforzandose y luchando por hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:" Tener un local propio".
texts.en:
Lizeth, 19, lives in the hamlet of San Martín de Porras, characterized as being formed several years ago by people who lost their homes in floods in the city of Ica.  Lizeth lives with her parents, whom she loves very much and supports with the fruit of her labor.  They were able to support her despite their humble situation, and she managed to study education.

Lizeth wasn't able to find a job in her field, so with great effort and savings she managed to start her own business selling cosmetics.  She works about 10 hours a day and can serve up to 10 customers because she visits them in their homes.  She believes she's getting ahead because she's friendly with her customers and also offers terms for making payments on the products.

Lizeth is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she'll be able to buy a piece of drywall to build her room.  The roof, which was made of rush mats and adobe, fell because of the rains.  With this improvement she'll be able to have a better quality of life and continue striving to make her biggest dream come true: "To have her own store."

loans.use: to buy drywall

location.town: Caserio San Martin de Porras - Ica

loans.name: Lauli

texts.en:
Lauli used the previous loan to buy cattle to sell as meat in his butcher shop. He is a 50-year-old, hardworking married man who lives in Kagadi, Uganda. 

Lauli owns a butcher shop that he has run for the past 21 years. He started with agriculture, from which he saved money to start his current business. He says price fluctuations and inflation are challenges that affect his business. He would like to educate his children and expand his business to new markets. 

Lauli intends to use the loan to buy cattle to sell as meat in his butcher shop.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell as meat in his butcher shop.

loans.name: Donozio

texts.en:
Donozio, age 30, operates a bar business, which he started from savings from his agricultural endeavors. He began the new business in order to provide a better standard of living for his family. He and his wife have two children, ages four and six, and the family lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He cites late payments as the primary challenge in his business.

In addition to his bar, Donozio also runs a motorcycle transport business, and he would like eventually to buy another vehicle for this venture. 

Donozio intends to use the loan funds to buy soda, beer, and spirits to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy soda, beer, and spirits to offer for sale

loans.name: Hisham

texts.en:
Hisham is a single, young, Palestinian man. He is pictured beside his taxi in the photo.

For the past five years, Hisham has been a taxi driver. He was unable to complete his studies because he faces very difficult living conditions and needs to help support himself and his family with his income.

Hisham's taxi needs a new engine and some maintenance work, but he cannot afford to make such improvements. As a result, Hisham is seeking a $1,500 loan from FATEN to help him cover the maintenance expenses and the cost of a new engine for his taxi.

loans.use: To improve his taxi business by repairing his taxi and purchasing new engine

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a 30-year-old, married lady, who has three children, all in school. She is employed by the local government as a primary school teacher, and she has been in service for a period of eight years. She was inspired to enter the teaching profession by her desire to nurture young people. 

Like all responsible mothers, Juliet desires to educate her children up to the university level. In addition, she wants to continue her own studies, because her ultimate career goal is to become a school principal. Juliet is requesting a loan to pay school fees required for the completion of her diploma course.

loans.use: to pay school fees that are required for the completion of her diploma course.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline used the previous loan to pay for her own tuition. She is a 27-year-old married woman with two children. She lives in Kagadi, Uganda. 

Jackline is a teacher by profession and has been in service for a period of seven years. She would like to educate her children and also upgrade in her studies, as she is currently a diploma holder.

Jackline intends to use the loan to pay her own tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 30-year-old married man with one child living in Kagadi Uganda. Three years ago he decided to venture into a local brew sales business after assessing its profitability and ready market. He is a very hardworking man who does other businesses such as teaching primary school and trading produce. He dreams of buying a vehicle and constructing a permanent home despite challenges of limited capital that affects his business growth. Joseph is requesting for a loan to buy local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy local brew to sell.

loans.name: Yuda Tadeo

texts.en:
Yuda Tadeo is a 30-year-old, married man, who has two children, aged 4 and 6 years. He resides in Kagadi, Uganda. He operates a retail store, which he started with savings from agriculture. He began this business in order to improve his family's welfare.

He would like to start a new business and even expand on the existing one. Late payments by customers and price fluctuations are factors affecting the growth of the business. Yuda Tadeo intends to use the loan to buy maize and beans to resell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to resell.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
La señora Luz es una persona de avanzada edad, ella tiene 67 años, vive junto a su hija y sus nietos a los cual adora con toda sus fuerzas, doña Luz se define como una mujer carismática, de carácter fuerte, humilde pro muy trabajadora, son estas cualidades que han hecho de la señora Luz, un ejemplo para toda su familia y para la comunidad viendo en ella un persona de admiración.  
El crédito solicitado a FODEMI, se lo invertirá en la compra la compra de caramelos, snacks , aguas, gaseosas y útiles y de aseo, para la venta ya que la Sra. Luz trabaja en  los baños públicos del centro comercial popular de la ciudad de Tulcán, y la venta de estos productos generan un ingreso para su familia a la cual ayuda.
El sueño que la señora Luz tiene es ver a sus nietos crecer y apoyarle a su hija que vive junto a ella, Luz pide la Salud a Dios para seguir viviendo y trabajando ya que le gusta ser útil a la sociedad y brindarles de lo que necesiten a sus nietos que ama con todo su corazón.
texts.en:
Luz, 67, is a person of advanced age.  She lives with her daughter and grandchildren, whom she adores with all her might.  Luz is a charismatic woman of strong character, modest but very hardworking.  These are qualities that have made Luz an example for her whole family and the community, who see her as an admirable person.

She's going to invest the loan she's requesting from FODEMI in buying candy, snacks, water, and soda to sell, and cleaning supplies.  Luz works in the public restrooms in the popular shopping center in the city of Tulcán, and selling these items generates an income for her family, whom she helps.

Luz's dream is to see her grandchildren grow up and to help her daughter, who lives with her.  Luz asks God for the health to continue living and working because she likes to be useful to society and give her grandchildren, whom she loves with all her heart, what they need.

loans.use: to buy candy, snacks, water, soda, and cleaning supplies

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza, de 48 años vive al lado de su esposo Esequiel y 3 de sus 4 hijos: Marianela, Satefany Y Brigit a los que cuida en la casa de su mamá desde hace 30 años. Desde hace 7 años se dedica a la venta de artículos de arcilla como ollas, cocinas, jarrones, vasos y alcancías, etc. Viaja los fines de semana a otras ciudades aledañas a la suya para vender y los primeros días de la semana se abastece con nueva mercadería, siempre cuenta con la ayuda de una de sus hijas  en sus viajes, quien le ayuda a vender y en sus días libres  también realiza ventas de  medicinas naturales a sus vecinos. Con el transcurso del tiempo ha visto mejorar sus ingresos y  sostener su capital, que crece poco a poco, considera que su negocio es rentable  porque le genera buenas rentas y puede apoyar su negocio adicionando el ingreso que genera su esposo que labora como profesor. Es por esta razón que  desea incrementar su  capital de trabajo, para mejorar su mercadería y así tener más clientes. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “la florida” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada, ya que obtiene la ayuda para progresar en su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le gusta trabajar en su asociación pues son personas responsables y solidarias.
Esperanza; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de más ollas de barro y animales de arcilla que sirve para el ahorro de dinero, eso le permitirá aumentar el capital de su negocio.
texts.en:
Esperanza is 48 years old and lives with her husband, Esequiel, and three of her four children: Marianela, Satefany and Brigit, whom she’s been caring for in her mother’s house for 30 years.  For the past seven years she has been selling clay pots, cookers, vases, cups, piggy banks, etc.  She travels to nearby cities on the weekends and stocks up on new merchandise.  She always gets help from her daughters on her trips and they also help her sell.  She also sells natural medicine to her neighbors. 

Over time she has seen her income and capital increase little by little.  She considers her business to be profitable because it produces an income and it supplements her husband’s income as a teacher.  It’s for this reason that she wants to increase her working capital so that she can buy more merchandise and have more customers.  She is a member of the “La Florida” group and this will be her fourth loan through MFP.  She feels developed because she gets the help she needs to progress in her business and promises to be on time with her payments.  She also likes working in her group because the members are responsible and united.

Esperanza will use the money from this loan to buy more clay pots and piggy banks.  This will allow her to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Flor Marleni

texts.es:
flor tiene 25 años de edad, vive al aldo de su pareja con quien tiene un lindo hijo de 6 años de edad y al cual queire muchisimo y por quien se esfuerza mucho para poder convertirlo en una persona de bien y sobre todo brindarle las oportunidades que ella no pudo tener; flor debido a sus pocos recursos eocnomicos soló pudo estudiar hasta el quitno grado de educacion secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado tener una carrera universitaria. 

Luego de mucho esfuerzo y ahorro Flor logro iniciar su negocio de venta de productos de belleza y cosmeticos, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al dia y puede atender hasta 10 clientes diariamente, ella cree que esta saliendo adelnate con su trabajo porque es muy resposanble y sobre todo porque es amable con los clientes y muy carismatica.

Flor esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podra comprar una vitrina para poder exhibir sus productos de mejor manera y poder mejorar sus ingresos, de esta manera podra vender mas productos y seguir esforzándose para hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:" Tener su casa propia".
texts.en:
Flor is 25 years old and lives with her husband and six year old son whom she loves very much and for whom she works very hard.  She wants him to become a person of means and above all provide him with the opportunities she didn’t have.  Flor, given her scarce resources, was only able to complete five years of middle school, but she would have liked to attend university.

After much effort and savings, Flor was able to start a business selling beauty products and cosmetics. She works eight hours a day and can serve up to 10 customers daily.  She believes that she is getting ahead in her work because she is very responsible and above all she is friendly to her customers and very charismatic.

Flor is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will be able to buy a display case to better show her products and increase her income.  In this way she can sell more products and continue to work to make her great dream, “having a home of her own,” a reality.

loans.use: Para la compra de vitrinas

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.es: La Sra. Cleofe sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de hamburguesas, cuenta que le fue muy bien con el anterior crédito que lo utilizo en el pintado de su kiosco en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como papa y carne para la elaboración de sus hamburguesas.
texts.en: Cleofe continues to sell hamburgers and she tells us that things went well for her with the previous loan which she used to paint her kiosk.  She is asking for a new loan to buy ingredients like potatoes and meat to make her hamburgers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Jose Beningno

texts.es: José Benigno de 56 años de edad, casado con dos hijos mayores de edad. Originario del Departamento de Managua, lugar que está ubicado en la zona central de país. Él es un hombre que se caracteriza por ser responsable, trabajador, de buenas costumbre, con ganas de superación personal. José tiene por actividad económica un tramo de venta de mochilas, desde hace 16 años que inicio dicha actividad. El cual inicio por la necesidad de tener un medio de trabajo  e ingresos, y aprovecho la liquidación que le pagaron en una empresa que trabajaba en los años 90 el cual ha sido el sustento de sus familia, y por sus ganas de superación, tenacidad, y por su capacidad de emprendimiento, el cual ha sido su medio de vida hasta la fecha. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en unos de los mercados de su ciudad. El objetivo del financiamiento es invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar más mochilas y aprovechar la entrada de clases de los niños y jóvenes, y de dicha forma en un futuro cercano mejorar sus ingresos.  José Benigno agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua.
texts.en:
José Benigno is 56 years old, married, and has two adult children.  He is from the Managua department, located in the central zone of the country.  He is known for being responsible, hardworking, of good customs, and with a desire to succeed personally.

José has been selling book bags for the past 16 years.  He started this because he needed a way to generate an income and he took advantage of the severance pay he received in the 90’s.  This used to be the way he supported his family, but thanks to his desire to succeed, his tenacity, and entrepreneurship, this is now the way he earns a living.

The business is located in one of the city’s two markets.  He will use the money from this loan to buy book bags so he can take advantage of the start of the school year and increase his income in the near future.  José Benigno is grateful to the Kiva lenders who help people of limited resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Richard

texts.es:
Richard es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Tahuantinsuyo  de la ciudad de El Alto.

El estudió hasta el nivel de Técnico Superior y actualmente desempeña las funciones de Profesor del Magisterio Rural en la localidad de Chuma, en los yungas de La Paz.

El crédito lo requiere para comprar material de construcción: cemento, ladrillos, fierro. Así podrá levantar una habitación para el y tener una mayor comodidad.

El sueño de Richard es tener su casita propia.

Es la Tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Richard is single and has no children.  He lives in his parents’ house in the Tahuantinsuyo area of the city of El Alto.  He has a higher-level of education.  

He now works as a teacher in the rural section of Chuma in the Yungas area of La Paz. 

He needs the loan to buy construction materials.  He will buy cement, brick, and iron.  This way he will be able to build a room for himself and be more comfortable.

Richard’s dream is to have his own little house.

This is the third time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and the first time from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, and iron in order to build a room at his parents' house so that he will be more comfortable.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
El señor Fernando vive en casa de sus padres, la casa está ubicada en la zona Tembladerani de la Ciudad de la Paz.

Fernando, efectúa el mantenimiento y ensamblaje de computadoras muchas veces por más de ocho horas; el crédito que solicita es para pagar un curso de instalación de redes ya  que su padre tiene un negocio de internet el cual será administrado por Fernando; el curso se relaciona con su actividad y además le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.

El sueño de Fernando es especializarse en el campo de las computadoras, y en el futuro generar más ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida.

Es la primera vez con IMPRO  y la primera vez que es parte de KIVA,
texts.en:
Fernando lives in his parents’ house located in the city of La Paz’s Tembladerani zone.  Fernando often works more than 8 hours daily assembling and servicing computer equipment.  The loan he’s requesting is to pay for a computer network installation course since his father has an Internet business that Fernando will manage.  The course is related to his activity and it will also help him improve his income.

Fernando’s dream is to specialize in the computer field and in future generate more income to improve his quality of life.  This is his first time with IMPRO and the first time he’s been part of KIVA.

loans.use: to pay for a computer network installation course.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for educational costs

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena, de 42 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Orlando, su esposo. Ambos tienen 4 hijos a los que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Chilca. Sus deseos de mantener la estabilidad familiar mantiene con muchas energías a Elena, quien se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, su trabajo consiste en criarlos en un corral que tiene en su casa. Más la actividad a la que se dedica durante todo el día es la venta de celulares en un espacio que alquiló en la zona céntrica de la ciudad, donde tiene muchos clientes que saben de los últimos celulares que trae cada mes. Comenta que su trabajo le resulta, pues siempre trae novedades, por esa razón espera poder seguir aumentando el capital de trabajo para seguir complaciendo a su clientela con las últimas tendencias. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “la florida” y este es el décimo crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada, ya que obtiene la ayuda para progresar en su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le gusta trabajar en su asociación pues son personas responsables y solidarias.
Elena, invertirá el dinero en la compra de 4 celulares para su venta.
texts.en:
Elena, 42, is a hardworking woman living with Orlando, her husband.  They have four children who they care for in their own house located in Chilca.  Her wish to maintain her family’s stability keeps Elena energized.  She works raising pigs which is constant work; she raises them in a corral she has at home.  During the day, she also works at a second activity which is selling mobile phones in a space she rents in a centrally-located spot in the city; she has many customers who are aware of the latest model mobile phones she brings every month.  She comments that her work has good results because she always brings novel items which is why she hopes to be able to continue increasing her working capital to continue to satisfy her customers with the latest trends.

She belongs to the “La Florida” communal bank and this is the 10th MFP loan.  She feels fulfilled because she gets the help needed to make business progress.  Because of this, she promises to be punctual with her payments.  She also enjoys working in her communal bank because the people are responsible and mutually supportive.  Elena will use the money to buy four mobile phones to sell.

loans.use: to buy four mobile phones at wholesale.

loans.name: Maria Haydee

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 61 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus  dos hijos, a quienes ama, lastimosamente María sufrió la pérdida de su querido esposo, desde entonces ella es el pilar de su familia y dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacarlos adelante, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, María no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar cursos de corte y confección, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, María trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta y alquiler de vestidos y ternos, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, María se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por el trato amable y buenos precios que brinda a sus clientes.
María se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad de vestidos y ternos para abastecer su negocio, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante y lograr su gran sueño de tener un puesto de ventas propio en un centro comercial de su ciudad.
texts.en:
María, 61, lives in the city of Pisco with her two children who she loves.  Sadly, María lost her beloved husband and since then she’s been her family’s pillar; she focuses all her efforts into moving them forward.  Sadly, due to the lack of economic resources and the need to go to work, María was unable to study a professional career but would very much have liked to study dress making.  She likes to listen to music in her free time and on occasion cooks a delicious ‘Arroz con Pollo’ [Chicken with Rice] to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with much effort and dedication, María works in her small business selling and renting dresses and suits.  She works every day starting very early in the morning and can work up to 10 hours approximately.  María feels comfortable doing her work and believes that she does well because of the kind treatment and good prices she provides her customers.

María is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she will be able to buy a larger amount of dresses and suits to stock her business so she can continue to work and strive to get ahead to reach her great dream of having her own sales stand in one of the city’s shopping centers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es: El Sr. Rogelio  tiene 45 años y es soltero, con tres hijos,  el se dedica a  servicio costura de variedad de disfraces según la época y la necesidad de sus clientes, en su taller propio que se encuentran en su mismo domicilio en la zona de Tembladerani , este préstamo es su cuarta secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Rogelio  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de tela para la confección de disfraces para carnavales,  El Sr. Rogelio  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la falta de maquinas  y a veces de material cuando le hacen pedidos por mayor depende de los trabajos que tiene que realizar y va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de distintas maquinas que necesita para la confección, El Sr. Rogelio  es una persona trabajadora que su deseo es tener un taller grande y contratar mano de obra y así enseñar a jóvenes el oficio de la confección.
texts.en:
Rogelio, 45, is single and has three children.  He works sewing a variety of costumes according to the season and his customers’ needs.  His workshop is his and is located at home in the Tembladerani zone.  This loan is his 4th cycle in the institution and Rogelio will use it to buy fabric to make Carnival costumes.  

Rogelio’s business challenge is the lack of sewing machines and sometimes supplies depending on the work he has to do when he gets wholesale orders.  He will use profits to buy the various sewing machines he needs.  Rogelio is a hardworking person who wants to have a larger workshop and to hire staff to teach youngsters the sewing occupation.

loans.use: to buy fabric to manufacture Carnival costumes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo, de 41 años es un hombre responsable. Vive en compañía de su esposa Karina y sus hijas a las que cuida en la casa que compró hace algunos años. Durante los primeros días de la semana dedica su tiempo en la atención de su tienda, el cual lo realiza gracias a sus hijas quienes ya son señoritas y llevan las cuentas del día. Cuando compró su casa, decidió abrir una tienda de comestibles pues no hay una en la zona, es así que desde entonces tiene buenos ingresos económicos, pues siempre se empeña en cuidar los gustos y exigencias de sus clientes, “ellos gustan de comprar en mi tienda, pues de esa manera no tienen que bajar a la ciudad a realizar las comprar”, afirma. Ahora desea progresar más y mejorar la tienda, ya que también se dedica al trabajo de construcción donde tiene buenos ingresos.  Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo económico recibido, el cual le ayudará a mejorar su negocio y a dinamizar sus ventas. Pues tendrá el capital para trabajar, por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Guillermo, invertirá el dinero en la compra de sacos de arroz y azúcar, además de leche, fideos y demás productos no perecibles.
texts.en:
Guillermo, 41, is a responsible man living with his wife, Karina, and their daughters who he cares for in a house he bought some years ago.  During the first days of the week he works in his store; he does this thanks to his daughters’ being young women now who control the daily accounts.  When he bought his house he decided to open a grocery store because there wasn’t one in the zone; he earns good income because he’s always careful to meet his customers’ needs and wants.  “They enjoy buying in my store because they don’t have to go down into the city to do their shopping,” he affirms.  Now, he wants to progress still more and improve the store because he also works in construction where he also earns good income.

This is his second MFP loan so he’s grateful for the economic support received that will help him improve his business and strengthen his sales because he’ll have working capital available; he promises to be punctual with his payments.  Guillermo will use the money to buy sacks of rice and sugar as well as milk, noodles and other non-perishables.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and sugar as well as milk, noodles and other perishables.

loans.name: Juan Edgar

texts.es:
El señor Edgar es  un hombre  emprendedor, ya que con la situación de edad y poco oportunidad de empleo creó su propia Micro Empresa , de la cual ya tiene 10 años de funcionamiento y actualmente mantiene el mercado establecido, ya que su actividad económica es el Hornear maní que compra a los recolectores de Residuos de  cosecha que queda en el campo,  es casado con 2 hijos a los que le brinda el apoyo incondicional como padre, también su esposa con su hija tienen un negocio de venta de Ropa en Managua como otra alternativa económica.


Actualmente este señor tiene la urgencia necesidad de comprar materia prima la cual está saliendo en esta fecha y almacenar dicho producto para permanecerse estable en el abastecimiento del mercado del cual tiene que viajar semanal, por eso visito a ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento para utilizarlo en la compra de 30 qq de maní,  el cual le vendrá a incrementar y estabilizar su producción  ya que lo vende empacados en bolsitas pequeños con algunos aditivos de sabores, y de esa  manera mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Edgar is an enterprising man because due to his age and the lack of employment opportunities he started his own business that has now been in operation for 10 years and is well established in the marketplace.  His economic activity is roasting peanuts that he buys from people who gather up the harvest leftovers.  He’s married and has two children that he provides unconditional support as a father.  His wife and daughter have another business selling clothes in Managua which is an additional source of income.

He currently urgently needs to buy raw materials that’s becoming available around this time to store it and remain stable and continue to supply the market he visits weekly.  Because of this, he’s seen fit to visit Ceprodel to request financing to buy 30 quintals of peanuts that will increase and stabilize his production because he sell it packaged in small bags with added flavors.  In this way he will improve his living conditions and his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy 30 quintals of peanuts.

loans.name: Lila Josefa

texts.es:
La señora Lila es una mujer  visionaria, su actividad económica la efectúa atravez de la profesión como maestra de educación primaria, su marido y su hijo son transportista de carga, es casada.
Actualmente tiene una necesidad de mejorar su vivienda la que está en mal estado, por eso se decidió visitar a ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento para la compra de cemento, hierro, zinc, perlin, arena y bloques para cambiar pilares, pared y techo y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Lila is a forward-looking woman.  Her economic activity is being an elementary school teacher.  Her husband and son work transporting heavy loads; she’s married.

She currently needs to make some improvements to her house that’s in bad shape which is why she decided to visit Ceprodel to request financing to buy cement, iron, metal sheeting, roof purlins, sand and concrete blocks to replace the pillars, walls and roof thus improving her living conditions and her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron, metal sheets, roof purlins, sand and concrete blocks.

loans.name: Samah

texts.en:
Samah is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Hatem appears next to his new taxi in her Kiva profile photo.

Samah is a 32-year-old young woman from Jabalia; she is married and a mother to two sons and three daughters. Samah's husband has been a taxi driver for the past four years, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income for the family.

Samah's husband would like to buy a new taxi to replace his old one, which has high maintenance costs. This will help the family to increase their income.

Samah is requesting a loan from FATEN in order to help her husband pay for his new taxi. This loan will help the family to increase their income and improve their living conditions.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The fundraising amount you see includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to pay for a new taxi.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Mohammad appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Eman is a 30-year-old married woman. She lives in Jabalia with her husband and four kids. Her husband earns a very low income that barely covers the family's needs. Eman would like to improve the living conditions of her family and buy bedroom furniture. 

Eman took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will enable Eman and her family to enjoy living in their house.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The fundraising amount you see includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to market his business.

loans.name: Hector Homero

texts.en:
Since his previous Accion Texas Inc. loan in January, Hector Homero says his business matured. Working with surrounding El Paso business owners to produce positive results, the Hispanic entrepreneurship instructor, business coach, CEO and founder of Ascend: Entrepreneurial Growth says the recipe for a good business is a good theory and process. This year, Hector Homero refined his process leading to business maturity. 

“This year, I’ve nailed that down better and have seen results,” he says, defining theory as the idea and the value of business structure, which differs between entrepreneurs. “I see the results clearer and more predictable now than last year,” he says. Hector Homero added he’s also learned, when focusing on the structure of the business, he can help an entrepreneur find the root of an issue then produce a quick solution. Hector Homero says he of course wants to guide his clients “through the long haul,” but his clientele doesn’t always stay past the beginning stages.

In his last interview, Hector Homero stated, “89 percent of small business owners in Texas are sole proprietors,” leaving them with 100 percent of the job obligations.  This statistic still holds true. As a sole proprietor himself, Hector Homero says he needs to improve his business before hiring, though he needs help now. “The idea is to grow,” he says. “Business growth is economic growth to the community,” however, it is a challenge to obtain, he says. Currently, Hector Homero offers one-on-one sessions which he then merges into round-table learning sessions he says helps clients network. 

This is Hector Homero’s third loan with micro-lender Accion Texas. He says, “Accion has helped me make the next step, it’s not a big one, but it’s one I need. I like Accion a lot. What I’m trying to do now, what I would like to be able to do, is get my business to pay off this loan and strategize a larger loan to get my business to the next level. Accion has become a part of my growth plan.”

His latest loan is to market his business and update software. Hector Homero purchased a Nuance program called Dragon Naturally Speaking, which transcribes voice to text and helps him cut the hour of work he normally takes to manually transcribe every meeting’s notes and track a client’s progress. “Everything I do now is the hard way; I need to be more efficient,” he says. “I need to work on my web page to where it works for me.” Hector Homero says to better his site, it would take the creation of more resources and a newsletter to draw people to the site.

To find out more about Hector Homero and his business, visit his website at: http://www.ascendeg.com. To view interviews with major corporation heads, visit heho.utep.edu.

loans.use: to market his business and purchase a voice-to-text system.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.es: La Sra. Mabel  tiene 24 años, ella se dedica a la venta de enaguas y polleras  para mujeres de polleras, tu tienda se encuentran en la zona Los Rosales,  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro la institución, La Sra. Mabel  va a usar este préstamo para la compra enaguas y polleras por mayor para  surtir su negocio ya que por esta fechas que se acerca el aniversario del barrio y tiene mucha venta, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incremento de capital de trabajo, La Sra. Mabel  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son surtir su mercadería y va a utilizar los beneficios e seguir comprando por mayor.
texts.en:
Sra. Mabel is 24 years old. She sells petticoats and women’s skirts. Her shop is located in the District of Los Rosales.

This is her second loan with Emprender. Sra. Mabel will use the loan to buy petticoats and skirts in bulk so that she can restock her business. The date of her neighborhood’s anniversary is approaching and she has many sales during that time. Her reason for requesting this loan is so that she can increase her operating capital. Sra. Mabel faces challenges in her business, such as having to restock her merchandise. She will utilize the benefits of this loan and continue to buy in bulk.

loans.use: to buy petticoats and skirts in bulk.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Amro appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Eman is a 25-year-old young woman. She lives in Beit Hanoun, Jabalia with her husband. Iman's husband is employed, with a very low wage. They want to improve their home by buying some necessary furniture such as living room furniture. 

Eman took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to buy new living room furniture. This loan will help Eman and her husband to enjoy living in their house and improve their living conditions.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase new living room furniture

loans.name: Marlyn Lissette

texts.es: La joven Marlyn mujer trabajadora sale adelante junto a su esposo quien se desempeña en albañilería con esos ingresos aporta para los gastos del hogar, ambos tienen dos hijos menores de 8 años uno va a la escuela, ellos continúan viviendo en casa de su suegra, poco a poco han ido mejorado la parte donde habitan para estar  más cómodos, esto gracias a las ganancias de su venta de golosinas, ropas, y también su trabajo en un negocio de fritanga, todo para obtener otro ingreso mas y poder cubrir los gastos del hogar, ahora necesita el crédito para componer su cuarto comprara zinc, cemento, hierro, arena, bloques, flywood, laminas lizas y perlines.
texts.en:
The young, hard-working woman, Marlyn, moves forward together with her husband who works in bricklaying.  With these incomes, they cover the home expenses.  Together they have two children under the age of eight years old; one goes to primary school.  

They continue living in her mother-in-law's house.  Little by little, they have improved the part of the home where they live to make it more comfortable.  This is thanks to the profits of her gasoline and clothing sales, as well as her work in a small, home-run restaurant.  Everything she does is to make more income and to be able to cover the home expenses.

Now, she needs a loan to repair her room.  She will buy corrugated metal roofing, cement, iron bars, sand, cinderblocks, flywood, metal sheets, and purlins.

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal roofing, cement, iron bars, sand, cinderblocks, flywood, metal sheets, and purlins to repair the room.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is a married man with five children. He resides in Kagadi, Uganda. He operates an electronics shop which he has run for four years now. He also operates a boutique business which supplements his income.

Abel dreams of buying a vehicle for personal use and trading in wholesale for both businesses, despite inadequate capital that affects his business growth. 

Abel intends to use the loan to buy electronics to sell.

loans.use: to buy electronics to sell.

loans.name: Massaba

texts.fr:
Née en 1960 à N’PIEBOUGOU, MASSABA vit avec ses huit  enfants et son époux dans une  famille traditionnelle dans le quartier SEGUESSONA de la ville de Ouelessebougou. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer dans les études,  très vite MASSABA s’est  intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente des habits en provenance de Bamako et des pagnes wax de Lomé (au Togo).    
MASSABA est à son deuxième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  50 pièces de pagnes wax  auprès des  grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché de Ouelessebougou et dans les foires  environnantes (Sido, Sélingué, Keleya)  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
MASSABA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born in 1960 in N'piebougou, Massaba lives with her eight children and her spouse in a traditional family in the Seguessona neighborhood in the town of Ouelessebougou.

Not having had the chance to advance her education, Massaba quickly became interested in income-generating activities, notably buying and selling clothing from Bamako and wax cloths from Lomé, Togo. 

Massaba is on her second loan with Soro Yiriwaso, which will be used to buy 50 pieces of wax cloth from wholesalers. She makes her sales in cash and on credit from her home, in the Ouelessebougou market, and at trade fairs in the surrounding neighborhoods of Sido, Sélingué, and Keleya to a male and female clientèle. 

Massaba hopes to make a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA, which will be used to help her husband support the family's needs, repay the loan, and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing and wax cloths to sell.

loans.name: Jacqueline Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora  Jacqueline, mujer trabajadora, lucha dia a dia para sacar adelante a sus  hijos, su compañero de vida le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ella es comerciante desde hace mas de 5 años, vende queso, frutas y verduras ella sueña con tener mejores condiciones y darles un buen porvenir a sus hijos, con este  nuevo credito quiere comprar mucho queso, frutas y Verduras para aprovechar la temporada navideña para que sus  ventas mejoren un poco, Agradece a Afodenic y  fondos Kivas por el apoyo prindado.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is a hardworking woman. She fights day after day to get her children ahead. Her life partner helps her with the household expenses. For over 5 years, she has sold cheese, fruits, and vegetables. Her dream is to have better conditions and to provide a better future for her children. 

With this new loan, she wants to purchase a lot of cheese, fruits, and vegetables to take advantage of the Christmas season, when sales increase a little. She is thankful for Afodenic and the Kiva loan for the support they provide.

loans.use: purchase cheese, fruits, and vegetables

loans.name: Norah

texts.es:
Norah es soltera y tiene dos hijos, ella estudio hasta el nivel de licenciatura pero actualmente no trabaja de su profesión, ella vive en casa propia en un acabado fino y piso de machimbre, la casa está ubicada en la zona de Achachicala de la Ciudad de La Paz. 

Norah tiene una tienda de abarrotes en la misma casa,  ella vende todo el día porque los únicos ingresos que percibe son de su tienda con lo cual ella cubre los gastos de servicios básicos, alimentación y de vestir.

El crédito lo solicita  para la Instalación de cabinas telefónicas que le ayudarán a expandir su negocio, además con un poco del dinero que le sobre comprará también arroz, azúcar, refrescos para aumentar su capital en la tienda.

El sueño de Norah es adquirir incrementar su tienda para que así también aumenten sus ingresos económicos.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
Norah is single and has two children.  She has a degree, but she does not now work in her profession.  She lives in her own house, which has fine finishing touches and a wood floor.  It is in the Achachicala zone of the city of La Paz.

Norah has a general store in her house.  The store covers the expenses for basic services, food, and clothing.

The loan she is requesting is to install telephone booths that will allow her to expand her business.  Also, with the little bit of money left over, she will also buy rice, sugar, and soft drinks to increase her capital in the store.

Norah’s dream is to add to and increase her store in order to also increase her income.

The is the first time she has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for the installation of telephone booths in her general store and to buy rice, sugar, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Adam

texts.fr:
Née en 1971 à BOUGOUNI, ADAM vit  une  famille traditionnelle  dans la ville de Ouelessebougou. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer dans les études,  très vite ADAM s’est  intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente des légumes et condiment alimentaire.   
ADAM est à son troisième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  un stock de produits alimentaires, constitué de colis de tomates fraiches, d’oignon, poivres, choux, aubergines, concombre, poissons séchés, fumés,  des bidons d’huile, sacs de sel de cuisine et des cartons de cube Maggi,  auprès des  grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché de Ouelessebougou et dans les foires  environnantes (Sido, Sélingué, Keleya)  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
ADAM espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born in 1971 in Bougouni, Adam lives in a traditional family in the town of Ouelessebougou.

Not having had the chance to advance her education, Adam quickly became interested in income-generating activities such as buying and selling vegetables and condiments. 

Adam is on her third loan with Soro Yiriwaso, which will be used to increase her stock of food items, such as parcels of fresh tomatoes, onions, peppers, cabbages, eggplants, cucumbers, dried smoked fish, cans of oils, bags of kitchen salt, and cartons of Maggi bouillon cubes from wholesalers. She makes her sales in cash, on credit, and for retail from her home, in the Ouelessebougou market, and in the surrounding neighborhoods of Sido, Sélingué,  and Keleya to a male and female clientèle. 

Adam hopes to make a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA, which will be used to support her family's needs, repay the loan, and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy food items to sell.

loans.name: Naser

texts.en:
Naser, age 37, has operated a grocery store business for the past two years. It has been a profitable project and serves as the only source of income for the family, but it needs more support to cover some necessary costs. For this purpose, Naser is requesting a Murabaha loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing needed stock of basic groceries that customers often request, such as rice, sugar, and milk. This will increase sales and increase Naser's income.

Naser lives with his wife and four children in Gaza city. 
 
About Shariah-compliant lending:
 
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to buy needed stock of basic grocery items, such as rice, sugar, and milk

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 55 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Elena has a rope-making business in the Philippines. Elena requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed like silk, nylon, polyesters etc. for her rope-making business.

Elena has been in this business for five years. In the future, Elena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like silk, nylon, polyesters etc. for her rope-making business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal, age 29, has operated a greenhouse for the past five years. He grows different types of seasonal crops, which has been a profitable project and the family's only source of income. He and his wife live in a small, peaceful village that is famous for its greenhouse agriculture.

Bilal wants to expand his project and purchase another greenhouse and seedlings to plant, so he is requesting a 3,000 USD Youth loan from FATEN to cover the cost of these purchases. Taking out this loan will allow Bilal to expand his project and produce a better crop, thus increasing his sales and improving the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase additional greenhouse and seasonal seedlings

loans.name: Olivia Mayela

texts.es:
Olivia es una mujer de 53 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con sus cuatro hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella siempre a sido padre y madre para sus hijos; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Olivia no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero pudo cursar pequeños estudios de repostería, en sus ratos libres cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Olivia trabaja desde hace varios años en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa interior, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su esfuerzo y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Olivia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de dos vitrinas y mayor cantidad de ropa interior, de esta manera Olivia tendrá su negocio mejor acondicionado y abastecido, con ello podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ampliar su negocio y tener su propio puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Olivia is a 53 year old woman who lives in the city of Cañete in the district of Imperial with her four children, whom she loves and who are her principal reason for living. She is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who dedicates all her effort to helping her family get ahead because she has always been both father and mother to her children.  

Unfortunately, due to a lack of resources and due to the need to work, Olivia was unable to follow a professional path but she was able to take a few courses in pastry making. In her spare time she cooks a very delicious “carapulcra con sopa seca” to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with a great deal of determination and dedication, Olivia opened a small business several years ago selling underwear for men, women and children. She works on average 8 hours every day starting early in the morning and believes she does well due to sacrifice and because of her friendly treatment of her customers.

Olivia is very grateful to KIVA lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to purchase two glass cabinets and underwear in greater volume so that her business will be better set up and stocked. In this way she will be able to wait on more clients and continue working in order to realize her great dream of expanding her business and having her own sales stall.

loans.use: to purchase two glass cabinets and merchandise.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila, de 47 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Romero, su esposo desde hace 25 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 de ellos: Efraín y Mía a la que cuida en su casa propia. 
Ella se siente muy feliz, pues acaba de tener su última hija, que tiene 2 años de nacida, a pesar de su edad siente que es la luz que ilumina su camino. Por ello trabaja con mucho ahínco para salir adelante, su principal actividad es la venta de jugos en un espacio que acondicionó en su casa, ya tiene 7 años dedicándose a ello, es conocida entre sus vecinos, además porque en épocas escolares, vende útiles de escritorio a los padres de familia, para el comienzo de la escuela. Pero la actividad que más le gusta es el tejido de chalinas variadas y muy coloridas, las cuales vende en un centro comercial muy conocido y visitado por turistas de todo el mundo. Tiene tiempo para todo y en especial para su esposo que llega después de 15 días a la casa, donde pasan un momento en familia, ya que trabaja en una mina, durante los demás días del mes. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “la florida” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada, ya que obtiene la ayuda para progresar en su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le gusta trabajar en su asociación pues son personas responsables y solidarias. Lucila de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de frutas para preparar sus jugos, y si el dinero le alcanza comprará útiles escolares para la venta en su tienda.
texts.en:
Lucila, 47, is a hardworking woman.  She lives with Romero, her husband of 25 years.  Together they have four children, but only two live with them, Efraín and Mía, whom she takes care of in her own house.  She's very happy because just just had her last child, a two-year-old daughter.  Despite her age she feels the child's the light that illuminates her road.  This is why she works with a lot of effort to get ahead.

Her main activity is selling juice in a space she adapted in her house.  She has been doing this for seven years already.  She's known among her neighbors, also because she sells school supplies to parents for the beginning of school.  But the activity she likes most is knitting an assortment of colorful shawls, which she sells in a very well-known shopping center frequented by tourists from around the world.

She has time for everything and especially for her husband, who comes home every two weeks to spend time with the family, because he works in a mine the rest of the month.

She belongs to the La Florida solidarity group and this is her fourth loan with MFP, where she feels fulfilled because she gets help to make progress in her business.  This is why she's committed to making her payments punctually.  In addition, she likes to work in her group because they're responsible and supportive people.

When Lucila receives her support she'll invest the requested money in buying fruit to prepare her juices.  If there's enough money, she'll also buy school supplies to sell in her store.

loans.use: to buy fruit to make juice

loans.name: Nelson Jose

texts.es: Nelson es un hombre que el tema educación lo lleva en la sangre, por vocación eligió en sus estudios universitarios una carrera a fines, actualmente se desempeña como maestro de educación secundaria en un colegio del departamento de león, con 29 años de laborar, es soltero sin hijos a su cargo,  este señor tiene una necesidad de mejorar su vivienda, tomando la decisión de visitar las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento, ya que el mismo lo utilizara en la compra de hierro 3/8, cemento, ½ metro de piedrín, arena, alambre, clavos, tablas de  5 varas, alfajillas hierro, zinc y mano de obra, para efectuar cambio de pilares y mejorar el techo los que están en mal estado, dichos esfuerzos los está realizando  para tener mejores condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Education is in Nelson’s blood. At university he chose courses that led to a professional career in that field. Now he is a secondary school teacher in a high school in the Department of León; he’s been a teacher for 29 years. 

Nelson is single and has no children. As he needs to make some renovations to his house, he made the decision to approach CEPRODEL to ask for a loan. He plans to use the money to buy galvanised steel, cement, gravel, sand, wire, nails, floorboards, steel studs, zinc roofing, and hire labourers in order to make improvements to the foundation and roof of his house as they are in bad condition. These changes will result in better living conditions and an improved standard of living.

loans.use: to buy galvanised steel, cement, gravel, sand, wire, nails, floorboards, steel studs, zinc roofing, and hire labourers

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 20-year-old, single man. He lives, with his family, a modest life in a small village. His father gets a low pension salary, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs.

For the past three years, Ahmad has been raising and selling sheep and sheep products, which has been a profitable business, but also needs more support to cover the family's needs. Ahmad is requesting a USD 3,000 youth loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN) to help him cover the costs of purchasing more sheep and additional fodder to feed the sheep. This will increase sales and improve the family's income. Ahmad is photographed with the herd.

loans.use: to buy more sheep and additional fodder.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan, con 35 años de edad,  es originario de la comarca Boaquito, Santa Lucia, padre  de 1 hijo, actualmente esta estudiando su tercer grado de primaria, de oficio agricultor se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol. Inicio su actividad trabajándoles a otras personas, pero luego decide independizarse, empieza a sembrar por si solo con dinero propio, pero los ingresos que ganaba no cubrían los gastos de la siembra  por ese motivo busco  como invertir en otro negocio como es la venta de leche, el  comercializa sus productos en la Ciudad de Sebaco, ya que el comercio es  mejor en esa zona.

Juan  requiere de este crédito para comprar  un caballo.  Ya que el estima que este préstamo le ayudaría a comprar el caballo para el acarreo de la leche  que le vende a sus clientes y asi se evita gastos extras, sus planes futuros es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa y comprar un carro para acarrear la leche, su meta próxima es comprar una maquina descremadora.
texts.en:
35-year old Juan is a native of the community of Boaquito, Santa Lucia. He has a son who is in grade three. To earn his living Juan grows maize and beans. At first he worked for other people but then decided to set up by himself. He used his own money to start out but his income didn’t cover all his expenses. As a result he looked for another business and now sells milk in the town of Sebaco, the best place for commerce in his area.

Juan needs a loan to buy a horse to help him transport the milk to his customers and thus avoid extra transportation expenses. His future plans include making improvements to his house and buying a vehicle to transport the milk. His next goal is to buy cream separator.

loans.use: buy a horse

loans.name: Yamileth De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Yamileth de los Ángeles, casada con un hijo de 1 ano de edad. Es originaria de Managua, lugar que está ubicado en la zona central de país. Ella es una mujer muy sociales, respetuosa, trabajadora, con ganas de superación persona. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho ser enfermera titulada.
Gracia a  su espíritu de emprendedor tiene por actividad económica una pulpera ubicada en su casa de habitación desde hace 5 años, actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto, ya que es el sustento de su familia. La rutina de  Yamileth es trabajar unas 12 horas diaria ofreciendo sus productos a sus clientes en su pulpería, una pulpería es una pequeña tienda donde se ofrecen productos de consumo diaria comestibles como arroz, frijoles, pan, leche, huevos, jugos, sal, detergentes, caja de fosforo, sobre de shampoo, sobre de café.
Yamileth se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva , ya que gracias a la ayuda que le brindan podrá realizar comprar y surtir su pulpería para satisfacer a su clientela y que en un futuro no muy lejano le genere mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Yamileth de los Ángeles, is married and has a one-year-old son. She is from Managua, a place located in the central area of the country. She is a very friendly, respectful, and hard-working woman, eager to improve herself. Unfortunately, because of a lack of financial resources, she wasn't able to complete a university degree, but would have very much liked to have become a nurse. 

Thanks to her enterprising spirit, she has had a small general store business in her home for five years, a business that she is very happy to carry on, as it is how she supports her family. 

Yamileth's routine is to work around 12 hours a day, offering her products to customers at her "pulpería". A "pulpería" is a small store where basic household necessities are sold, such as rice, beans, bread, milk, eggs, juice, salt, detergents, matches, as well as packets of shampoo and coffee. 

Yamileth is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help they provide her, she will be able to undertake purchases and stock her general store. This way she can satisfy her clientele, and in the not-too-distant future, generate better income.

loans.use: To invest in working capital and stock her small general store.

loans.name: Mirna Isabel

texts.es:
Estimados señores, doña Mirna es comerciante de granos básicos y ropa de adultos, su negocio tiene nueve años de estar funcionando.
Su negocio ha mejorado , sin embargo hay mucho mas en que invertir y dar una mejor atención al cliente, ampliando su línea de productos por lo que en estos momentos necesita un financiamiento que logre diversificar su actividad comercial 
Ella es de oficio maestra de primaria y con la ayuda de sus hijos iniciaron este nuevo negocio para obtener otros ingresos en la familia y de esta forma poder atender los gastos de salud y educación.
Es madre soltera y con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ladies and Gentlemen: Mirna sells staple items and clothing for adults.  She has run her business for nine years.

Her business has improved, but there's a lot more in which to invest and give better customer service by expanding her line of products.  This is why she needs a loan right now, to diversify her sales activity.

She's an elementary-school teacher by profession.  She started this new business with the help of her children to get another income for the family to take care of health and education expenses.

She's a single mother and has managed to get her children ahead with a lot of effort.

loans.use: to buy general clothing and rice, beans, sugar, and corn

loans.name: Wilber Antonio

texts.es: Wilber  es un joven emprendedor, además de ser profesional ostentando la especialidad de ingeniero en sistema, también ejerce un pequeño  negocio  como es  la venta de Ropa y perfumes para hombre, actualmente labora en el ministerio de educación de la zona donde habita, desempeñándose como responsable de estadísticas, este joven se presento a las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento para incrementar el inventario de la mercadería que vende y lograr la oportunidad de negocio de la época navideña, que es cuando se mejoran  las ventas, ya que el mismo lo utilizaría en la compra de Camisetas Sport para hombre y Perfumes de Hombre, es soltero y con gran entusiasmo de superar y mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Wilber  is a young businessman in addition to training to be a systems engineering professional. He manages a small business selling clothing and cologne for men. He currently works for the Ministry of Education in his local town, where he is in charge of statistics. This young man came to the offices of CEPRODEL to apply for a loan in order to increase his inventory of retail merchandise and take advantage of the holiday season business, where he makes his best sales. The loan will be used to purchase casual shirts and colognes. Wilber is single and possessed of a great enthusiasm to get ahead and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase casual shirts and cologne for men.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stove

loans.name: Domingo Ramiro

texts.es: Ramiro es un hombre trabajador, del cual con el fruto del mismo y las condiciones económicas de la época apoyo a sus hijos en sus estudios, actualmente todos tienen su vida propia, labora como operador de bomba de una empresa  de la comunidad donde vive, es casado su esposa tiene una pequeña pulpería en la casa donde habita, este señor se presento a ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento y realizarse el tratamiento médico necesario, del cual seria para cubrir gastos de costo de exámenes, consulta y compra de medicamento para mejorar la salud y nivel de vida,
texts.en:
Ramiro is a hardworking man. His work and the economic conditions at the time enabled him to support his children when they were studying. Now they all have their own lives. He works as a pump operator in a company in their local area. He is married and his wife has a small grocery store in the house where they live. 

He has requested a loan from CEPRODEL to pay for medical treatment that he requires. The finance will cover the cost of tests, consultation fees and medication. This will improve his health and quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for medical treatment, such as tests and consultation fees, and to buy medication

loans.name: Ervin Domingo

texts.es: Ervin es unos de los padres comprometidos con el desarrollo profesional de sus hijos y protector de la salud de su familia, es casado y con el gran anhelo de seguir apoyando los estudios universitario de la hija que tiene a su cargo, ya que el año pasado se le graduó la hija mayor, por eso visito a ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento y continuar forjando el sueño de su hija y el de ellos propio como padres, ya que dicho financiamiento lo utilizara en los gastos universitarios y tratamiento médico, de esa manera mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida de su familia, del cual se siente muy agradecido con ceprodel y los inversionistas de kiva por el apoyo que brindan a los sectores de bajos recursos pero con gran entusiasmo de superar.
texts.en:
Ervin is one of those fathers committed to the professional development of their children and the protector of the health of his family. He is married and with the great desire to continue supporting the university studies of his daughter who is in his care since last year his older daughter graduated. 

Because of this, he visited Ceprodel to request funding and to continue forging their daughter’s and their dream as parents, since he will use that loan to pay the university expenses and medical treatment. Therefore, he will improve the conditions and standard of living of his family, for which he feels very thankful to Ceprodel and the investors with Kiva for the support that they provide to sectors with low incomes but with great enthusiasm to overcome their situations.

loans.use: to pay his daughter's university expenses and medical expenses.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI est un groupe de l’association Sabougnouma de N’tentou. Il regroupe 4 femmes mariées qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans,  4 enfants, et  mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de cosmétiques,  de céréales et des habillements à l’image de ADAMA  qui est tout de noire vêtue de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à 
N’tentou (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y’a 4 ans. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire. 
ADAMA, qui est très connue à N’tentou et excelle dans la vente d’habillements et de céréales. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 sacs  de riz local et 1 balle de friperie.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses produits à  N’tentou, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Benkadi is a group from the Sabougnouma Association of N'tentou. The group consists of four married women who know each other from their neighborhood and family ties. On average, they are 30 years old and have four children. They all have diverse businesses, selling cosmetics, cereals, and clothing like Adama, the woman dressed all in black, is wearing. They live in large traditional families in N'tentou, which is in the Koulikoro region in the Republic of Mali.

They have had their small businesses for many years and are highly sought after by their clientèle. 

To meet growing customer demand, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program four years ago. They are on their sixth group loan.

Adama is very well-known in N'tentou and excels at selling clothing and cereals. She intends to use her loan to buy two bags of local rice and one bale of secondhand clothing. She gets her supplies in Bamako and from local wholesalers, and sells her products in N'tentou for retail, for cash, and on for credit to a male and female clientèle.

She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA, which would allow her to repay her loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy various items such as rice and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Walter Jesus

texts.es:
Walter Jesus  tiene 34 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene una hija, vive con la esposa y con la hija en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

LA VRC DULCE SENTIMIENTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Caimito II, parroquia  Puerto Pechiche Perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Walter Jesus se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza en el Cantón ventanas. 

Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos, urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá comprar los insumos agrícolas para las siembras.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas, mal clima y la competencia. El sueño es comprar maquinaria una aradora.
En los tiempos libres le gusta descanzar, ver televisión.
texts.en:
Walter Jesus, 34, is in a common-law marriage and has a daughter.  He lives with his wife and daughter in the Ventanas canton of Los Rios province. 

The communal bank "Dulce Sentimento" is located in Recinto Caimito II, in Puerto Pechiche parish in the canton of Pueblo Viejo.  The members of this bank work in short cycle agriculture, cultivating corn, rice, and pigeon peas. 

Walter Jesus is a farmer who cultivates corn, rice, and pigeon peas.  He makes his purchases and sales in Ventanas canton.

Walter Jesus is requesting a loan to buy seeds, supplies, urea, herbicides, fertilizers and brushkiller to maintain his crops in good condition.

This loan will be a big help, because he will be able to buy the agricultural supplies he needs for his crops.  In his business, Walter Jesus faces the challenges of pests, bad weather, and the competition.  His dream is to buy a mechanical plow. 

In his spare time, Walter Jesus likes to rest and watch TV.

loans.use: to buy seeds, supplies, urea, herbicides, fertilizers and brushkiller

loans.name: Katherine Yuliana

texts.es:
Katherine es una mujer de 23 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su pareja y sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una  persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su pareja dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Katherine no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta leer y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Katherine trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, adicionalmente también se dedica al alquiler de disfraces, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Katherine se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de construcción, como cemento, ladrillos, arena y otros, ya que con ello desea culminar la construcción de un cuarto en vivienda, de esta manera podrá brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ampliar su negocio y tener una gran tienda comercial.
texts.en:
